sec.div: 3.3. Equilibrium Population Structure after Seasonal Changes
sec.p: The fraction of young in the population decreases both when the onset of spring advances and when the food peak advances. In many cases, the effect of changed resource peak is again very small, however (purple lines are close to 1 in large parts of Figure 3K–O). Effects of s and r on population structure follow the same pattern as the effects of s and r on selection and population density: high population densities ( Figure 2F–J) predict more effect of s than of r.
